info.name: EfficientNet
info.description: A collection of high-end image classification models, with transfer learning weights, scaling from 4 to 28M parameters. Great for complex usecases on Linux.

parameters.name: Number of training cycles
parameters.help: Number of epochs to train the neural network on.

parameters.name: Learning rate
parameters.help: How fast the neural network learns, if the network overfits quickly, then lower the learning rate.

parameters.name: Use pretrained weights
parameters.help: If enabled, transfer learns on existing ImageNet trained weights. For most usecases you want to keep this enabled.

parameters.name: Freeze % of layers
parameters.help: The percentage of layers in the transfer learning base model to freeze. These layers will not be retrained.

parameters.name: Neurons in last dense layer
parameters.help: One dense layer is added after the EfficientNet base model, these are the number of neurons in this layer. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: Dropout in last dense layer
parameters.help: One dense layer is added after the EfficientNet base model, this is the dropout after this layer. Set to 0 to disable.

parameters.name: Batch size
parameters.help: The batch size to use during training. Consider reducing this for larger models.

parameters.name: Enable early stopping
parameters.help: If enabled, stops training when there's no improvement in the loss.

parameters.name: Early stopping patience
parameters.help: Number of epochs with no improvement after which training will be stopped.

parameters.name: Early stopping min. delta
parameters.help: Minimum change in the monitored quantity to qualify as an improvement, i.e. an absolute change of less than min_delta, will count as no improvement.
